title: Nectar of Devotion | HDG Srila Prabhupada | 10.08.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: Caitanya Mahāprabhu said, this ocean is increasing.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the Nectar of Devotion as an ocean of spiritual bliss, contrasting it with the limited nature of material enjoyment.

segments.key_quote: Spiritual bliss is different. That is simply increasing.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the difference between limited material enjoyment and the unlimited, ever-increasing nature of spiritual bliss experienced by yogis.

segments.key_quote: I have several times explained that the love affairs between Kṛṣṇa and Rādhārāṇī, that is fact.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the eternal and factual nature of the love between Krishna and Radha, and Krishna's relationships with other devotees, highlighting the eternal nature of spiritual relationships.

segments.key_quote: So the blissful enjoyment with Kṛṣṇa, it is unlimited.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Krishna's expansions and the unlimited blissful enjoyment derived from devotional service, contrasting the enthusiasm of spiritual work with the fatigue of material labor.

segments.key_quote: So here we are trying to enjoy materially. So how we can be happy? That is not possible.
segments.summary: This segment contrasts material and spiritual enjoyment, emphasizing that true happiness comes from understanding Krishna's sac-cit-ananda nature.

segments.key_quote: Those who have no knowledge about Kṛṣṇa, they are thinking Kṛṣṇa is māyā.
segments.summary: This segment addresses the misconceptions of Mayavadi philosophers regarding Krishna's form, emphasizing the importance of understanding Krishna's chit-potency.

segments.key_quote: Killing this body does not mean killing yourself.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the nature of the material body and the consequences of suicide, explaining that killing the body does not end suffering.

segments.key_quote: Killing this body does not mean killing yourself.
segments.summary: This segment continues the discussion on suicide, explaining the concept of the ghostly body and the purpose of the sraddha ceremony.

segments.key_quote: Everyone is anda, blind. They have no gain, no knowledge, and misleading, always.
segments.summary: This segment criticizes blind leaders and the pursuit of material enjoyment, emphasizing that true enjoyment comes from the spirit soul.

segments.key_quote: They want to enjoy life with ananta, Kṛṣṇa.
segments.summary: This segment describes the different relationships devotees can have with Krishna and the importance of understanding the Vrindavana Lila.

segments.key_quote: We are spiritual soul, spiritual spark. Our life is ānanda, sac-cid-ānanda, eternal life, blissful life, life of knowledge.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the nature of the spiritual soul and the contrast between spiritual and material existence, criticizing the Mayavadi philosophers' understanding of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So this Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement is therefore giving them the real knowledge.
segments.summary: This segment explains the purpose of the Krishna consciousness movement in providing real knowledge about Krishna and refutes the idea of an impersonal God.

segments.key_quote: So the Bhakti-raha-sāmṛta-sindhu is teaching people how you can enjoy in the ocean of blissfulness.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the Bhakti-raha-samrita-sindhu and Rupa Goswami's division of the ocean of nectar into four parts.

segments.key_quote: The first part, Bhakti-raha-sāmṛta-sindhu, the first wave is what is the meaning of bhakti.
segments.summary: This segment describes the four waves of the first part of the Bhakti-raha-samrita-sindhu, focusing on the meaning of bhakti, regulative principles, and devotional service in ecstasy.

segments.key_quote: But the spiritual platform is, as you are engaged in spiritual activities or devotional service, you become cleansed.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the spiritual platform and the importance of hearing about Krishna, emphasizing that Krishna is within everyone.

segments.key_quote: If you kindly hear about Kṛṣṇa. Unfortunately, even we do not get time to hear about Kṛṣṇa.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the importance of hearing about Krishna and how it purifies the heart, even if one doesn't fully understand.

segments.key_quote: That type of literature, which is describing Kṛṣṇa, nāmāni anantasya yasvaṁ kitāni yad, yatra, in which, in that literature, where simply there is glorification of the Lord Kṛṣṇa.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the importance of literature that glorifies Krishna and how devotees (sadhus) appreciate such literature.

segments.key_quote: Even it is not properly composed, but because there is anantasya, anantasya guṇāne, the glorification of ananta, the Supreme, śrīṇanti gāyanti gṛṇanti sādhavaḥ, those who are sādhus, actually, they accept it.
segments.summary: This segment explains that even if literature describing Krishna has grammatical errors, it is still valuable if it glorifies the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: The real thing is how much you are feeling for Kṛṣṇa. That is one thing.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the importance of feeling for Krishna and the society's purpose in providing opportunities to hear about Him in the association of devotees.

segments.key_quote: Those who are not Vaiṣṇava, those who are not devotees, one should not hear from them. It is useless. It is useless, waste of time.
segments.summary: This segment stresses the importance of hearing about Krishna from devotees and avoiding professional reciters or non-devotees.

segments.key_quote: Kṛṣṇa is there. You haven't got to search out Kṛṣṇa. He is already within you.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Krishna helps those who are sincere and cleanses the dirty things within their hearts.

segments.key_quote: You can remain your position. You don't require to change your position.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how one can conquer Krishna by remaining in their position and hearing from the proper source, using the example of Yasoda Maharaja.

segments.key_quote: So you can become mother of Kṛṣṇa, you can become father of Kṛṣṇa.
segments.summary: This segment concludes by emphasizing that devotees can become the mother or father of Krishna, highlighting Krishna's desire to be controlled by His devotees and the essence of Krishna's life in Vrindavana.
